DefineList.Id: PIO List for Wired Audio Detection Inputs

ConfigItem.Desc: User Event or System Event associated with the configuration.
AT Command to send when the mapped System or User Event occurs.
Raw data for AT command
Pio mask.
In addition to the Logical Input mask stimuli, the VREG enable signal can be configured as a stimulus for the mapped System or User event.
In addition to the Logical Input mask stimuli, the Charger detect signal can be configured as a stimulus for the mapped System or User event.
State mask.
Specifies the duration for which the selected Logical Input must be asserted in order to generate the mapped System or User Event.
(internal) button number to assign, 0 to 15
physical input

DefinePattern.PatternName: Module1 Example Pattern with Config Array

ConfigItem.Desc: User Event that will be originated when the mapped Button Sequence is asserted in the correct order.
Example use of a array in a pattern 0
Example use of a array in a pattern 1
Example use of a array in a pattern 2
Example use of a array in a pattern 3
Example use of a array in a pattern 4
Example use of a array in a pattern 5
The audio channel that will be mapped
Select the audio output hardware type
Select the hardware instance that should be used for this audio output.
Select the channel that this audio should be mapped to.
The volume trim to apply to the channel, expressed in units of 1/60th of a dB.
The audio outputs for which the volume curves apply.
Sets the number of volume steps between minimum and maximum volume.
Sets the minimum volume level for the audio output group, in dB units.
The first index into the list of discrete volume steps at which the gradient of the dB conversion curve changes. Warning: this value must to be smaller than the Knee Value 2 Volume Step Index.
The value in dB at the first point at which the gradient of the dB conversion curve changes. Warning: this value should always be configured within the range set by minimum and maximum volumes.
The second index into the list of discrete volume steps at which the gradient of the dB conversion curve changes. Warning: this value needs to be greater than the Knee Value 1 Volume Step Index.
The value in dB at the second point at which the gradient of the dB conversion curve changes. Warning: this value should always be configured within the range set by minimum and maximum volumes.
Sets the maximum volume level for the audio output group, in dB units.
HFP volume profile identifier.
The Volume Profile Id that will be selected when a Volume Up event occurs.
The Volume Profile Id that will be selected when a Volume Down event occurs.
Specifies the Audio Tone that the Sink will play on entering this Volume Profile.
Specifies the gain that will be applied in dBr for this Volume Profile.
An audio prompt will be played when the event selected in this column occurs.
This column specifies the index of the audio prompt file in the VM application file system. This field is autogenerated by the Configuration Tool and should not be directly written by the user.

This column specifies the VM application system states for which the configured audio prompt can be played. If the configured event occurs and the VM application is in a state masked off, then the audio prompt will not be played.
When checked the audio prompt will not be played if SCO or wired audio is currently routed.
When checked any queued audio prompts or tones will be flushed prior to playing this audio prompt.
Specifies the event type
Specifies the tone type
Event for which the pattern filter is defined.
Determines the type of filter to be applied when the filter is activated. Setting this value will specify which filter parameters will be used by the Sink for this filter.

enum.disable: Speed Factor,Speed Action,Colour,Filter to Cancel,LED to Use,Follow LED Delay [ms]
Speed Factor,Speed Action,Colour,LED to Use,Follow LED Delay [ms]
Colour,Filter to Cancel,LED to Use,Follow LED Delay [ms]
Speed Factor,Speed Action,Colour,Filter to Cancel,Follow LED Delay [ms]
Speed Factor,Speed Action,Filter to Cancel,LED to Use,Follow LED Delay [ms]

ConfigItem.Desc: Defines the LED(s) that the sequence will display when the COLOUR filter is active.
Defines the filter that will be cancelled when this CANCEL filter becomes activated. The filter number - e.g. 'Filter 0' - will cancel the filter configured at row index 0 in this table.
Specifies the PIO that will be driven when either the OVERRIDE or FOLLOW filter is active. (This field is shared by both filter types).
Defines the time offset in ms between the original pattern flashes and FOLLOW filter pattern flashes, when it is active (in 50ms steps).
This field specifies the action to apply to the LED pattern when the SPEED filter is active.
The multiplier/divider to be applied to the LED pattern when the SPEED filter is active.
If this flag is set then this LED pattern will be shown regardless of whether the LEDs have been disabled or not.
Extended State ID
0-2550ms (in 10ms steps)
0-2550ms (in 10ms steps)
0-10,000ms (in 50ms steps)
Specifies the number of times the sequence will repeat (unless superceded by another event) before it times out. When set to 0 the sequence will not time out. 0-255

The time between ramp steps to use. There are 16 ramping steps used to Dim on or off an LED. It is important to ensure that the (Dim time * 16) is less than the on time /off time for the ramp to complete. 0-255
How many flashes in the pattern - 0-15
Specifies the PIO that is referred to in the PS Key attributes as LED A
Specifies the PIO that is referred to in the PS Key attributes as LED B
If this flag is set then this LED pattern will be shown regardless of whether the LEDs have been disabled or not
Defines the LED(s) that the sequence will display when a filter is not applied
Event ID
0-2550ms (in 10ms steps)
0-2550ms (in 10ms steps)
0-10,000ms (in 50ms steps)
Specifies the number of times the sequence will repeat (unless superceded by another event) before it times out. When set to 0 the sequence will not time out. 0-255

The time between ramp steps to use. There are 16 ramping steps used to Dim on or off an LED. It is important to ensure that the (Dim time * 16) is less than the on time /off time for the ramp to complete. 0-255
How many flashes in the pattern - 0-15
Specifies the PIO that is referred to in the PS Key attributes as LED A
Specifies the PIO that is referred to in the PS Key attributes as LED B
If this flag is set then this LED pattern will be shown regardless of whether the LEDs have been disabled or not
Defines the LED(s) that the sequence will display when a filter is not applied
Physical PIO that maps to the GAIA PIO at this position
word 1 [hex]
word 2 [hex]

enum.key: When Connected To Hub Trickle Charge

ConfigItem.Desc: Set to use this entry to control the charger
Boost charging can be disabled or set to internal or externally controlled boost if the device and firmware revision supports it.
The voltage source for the IC can be set to CHARGER or Vbat
When checked the application will reduce to the minimum power consumption possible. Useful for powering off the device at certain temperatures.
When set the LEDs are disabled while charging.
Charge current specified in mA.
When Vbat (ie. the battery voltage level) crosses the threshold specified in this setting it will cause the mapped notification event to be raised.
0-2550 seconds in 10 second steps (rounded down)
The notification events raised can be configured to be sent during any of the specified operating modes.

bitfield.key: On User Request for Battery Level
On Initial Reading for Battery Level

ConfigItem.Desc: The User or System Event mapped to the Vbat threshold transition.
Vthm Limit Thresholds are set in Vthm Thremistor Configuration.
Set to use this entry to control the charger
Boost charging can be disabled or set to internal or externally controlled boost if the device and firmware revision supports it.
The voltage source for the IC can be set to CHARGER or Vbat
When checked the application will reduce to the minimum power consumption possible. Useful for powering off the device at certain temperatures.
When set the LEDs are disabled while charging.
Charge current specified in mA.
Either use the device default or specify a custom voltage limit to terminate charging.
Termination voltage in mV. Only used if Termination Type is Voltage.
A logical partition can be double or single banked and mounted as a filesystem, unmounted or erased after the upgrade has completed.

enum.desc: Single banked partition containing a raw serial partition. The partition will be erased after the upgrade has completed.
Double banked partition containing a raw serial partition. The active partition will not be added to the file system after the upgrade has completed.
Double banked partition containing a read only partition. The active partition will be added to the file system table after the upgrade has completed.

ConfigItem.Desc: The SQIF partition to use for this logical partition.
The second SQIF partition to use for double banked logical partitions.
Volume of the Main output channel.
Volume of the Auxilliary output channel.
If simple speech recognition is enabled.
User defined Variable Tones initilization value
This item indicates whether the Audio Prompt feature is enabled.
This item stores the selected audio prompt set.
Logic state of user-configurable PIO
Note: 0x7 selects the option to use the last customer defined Equaliser settings.
This is the volume level used after initial power up. The default volume can be set in the range 0 to 15. The sixteen levels are the 'Speaker Gain' settings in the Voice pane.

This configuration item specifies which HFP plug-in is used for SCO audio connections. When 'No DSP' is selected, always ensure that both: A) 'Modified SBC' is deselected in 'Supported HFP Codecs' on the page 'Bluetooth > BR/EDR Profiles > HFP'. B) HFP_CODEC_NEGOTIATION is deselected in 'Supported HFP Features' on the page 'Bluetooth > BR/EDR Profiles > HFP > Supported Features'.

ConfigItem.Id: One Mic Back Channel DSP Kap File Selection
ConfigItem.Desc: Determines if the low latency DSP applications should be used when negotiating the aptX and Faststream codecs which provide additional CVC wideband back channel support.

ConfigItem.Id: Two Mic Back Channel DSP Kap File Selection
ConfigItem.Desc: Determines if the low latency DSP applications should be used when negotiating the aptX and Faststream codecs which provide additional CVC wideband back channel support.

ConfigItem.Id: Drive PIO for Voice Mic A

ConfigItem.Desc: Selects the digital microphone inputs when set.
Enables the microphone preamplifier when set. This only has an effect when the Audio plugin is used. CVC audio plugins automatically adjust the input gain of the device.

ConfigItem.Id: Audio Instance for Voice Mic A

ConfigItem.Desc: Sets the gain of the analogue input path.

ConfigItem.Id: Drive PIO for Voice Mic B

ConfigItem.Desc: Selects the digital microphone inputs when set.
Enables the microphone preamplifier when set. This only has an effect when the Audio plugin is used. CVC audio plugins automatically adjust the input gain of the device.

ConfigItem.Id: Audio Instance for Voice Mic B

ConfigItem.Desc: Sets the gain of the analogue input path.
Selects the digital line inputs when set.
Enables the preamplifier when set. This only has an effect when the Audio plugin is used. CVC audio plugins automatically adjust the input gain of the device.
Sets the gain of the analogue input path.
Selects the digital line inputs when set.
Enables the preamplifier when set. This only has an effect when the Audio plugin is used. CVC audio plugins automatically adjust the input gain of the device.
Sets the gain of the analogue input path.

When set, this checkbox controls whether a wired analogue input is connected through to the DSP as a Stereo stream. If it remains unchecked, wired analogue audio will be connected as a Mono source. Note: this Configuration Item is only relevant for wired analogue input routing, not I2S, S/PDIF or any other wired sources.

This configuration item specifies the ADC Input audio bit resolution. Note: This configuration item is only relevant for analogue audio input and this is only applicable where the hardware supports it.

ConfigGroup.Id: Audio Assignment to Left and Right Outputs

ConfigItem.Id: Channel to be Routed to Left Output
ConfigItem.Desc: Determines the audio channel that will be routed to the left output.

ConfigItem.Id: Channel to be Routed to Right Output
ConfigItem.Desc: Determines the audio channel that will be routed to the right output.
Specifies the compression profile to be used for the AC3 audio.
This specifies the Cut to be applied, as a percentage.
This specifies the Boost to be applied, as a percentage.
Specifies the audio output mode, which can be either 2.0 or multi-channel.
This setting determines the downmix mode to use when multichannel AC3 audio is to be reproduced over stereo audio output.
When checked enables the LFE (Low Frequency Effect) algorithm.
When checked enables Karaoke Capability feature.
Determines how the audio output should be rendered in dual mono mode.
When checked enables channel routing.
These flags specify which codecs are to be supported as SPDIF inputs. If no codecs are selected SPDIF input will expect PCM. N.b. a license is required if AC3 audio is to be used.

This configuration item specifies the SPDIF Input audio bit resolution. Note: this configuration item is not applicable for CSR8670. Furthermore it is supported for PCM audio over SPDIF only and not for any other coded audio.
Specifies the target latency, in ms. Expected to be in the range of 0 to 150ms.
When set the USB audio is routed even when it is not in use.

ConfigItem.Id: USB Audio Paused When Source Switched
ConfigItem.Desc: When set the USB audio is paused when switching from USB to another source.
Sets the USB operating mode.
Specifies the DSP plug-in to be used for Voice operating mode.
If after attaching the USB it does not enumerate within the attach timeout, in seconds, the Sink will set low power boot mode.
If the USB becomes deconfigured and no further action is taken within the deconfigured timeout period, in seconds, the Sink sets to low power boot mode.
Class of USB Device
ConfigItem.displayValue: Microphone Audio | Speaker Audio | Battery Charging | Consumer Transport Control

ConfigItem.Desc: Selects between automatic priority based input switching (typically used in a headset) and manual source selection driven by user events.

ConfigItem.Id: Audio source switching delay after disconnection
ConfigItem.Desc: Configurable audio source switching delay after source disconnection [in msec]

ConfigItem.Id: Delay for audio active pio going to the active state for TWS [ms]
ConfigItem.Desc: Delay for audio active PIO to be enabled in milliseconds for TWS audio. Delays the audio output from being enabled, in order to mask audio glitches when an AG starts or resumes A2DP playback for TWS.

ConfigItem.Id: Enable audio source by assigning it to Priority 1.
ConfigItem.Desc: Enable audio source by assigning it to Priority 1.

ConfigItem.Id: Enable audio source by assigning it to Priority 2.
ConfigItem.Desc: Enable audio source by assigning it to Priority 2.

ConfigItem.Id: Enable audio source by assigning it to Priority 3.
ConfigItem.Desc: Enable audio source by assigning it to Priority 3.

ConfigItem.Id: Enable audio source by assigning it to Priority 4.
ConfigItem.Desc: Enable audio source by assigning it to Priority 4.

ConfigItem.Id: Enable audio source by assigning it to Priority 5.
ConfigItem.Desc: Enable audio source by assigning it to Priority 5.

ConfigItem.Id: Enable audio source by assigning it to Priority 6.
ConfigItem.Desc: Enable audio source by assigning it to Priority 6.

ConfigItem.Id: Enable audio source by assigning it to Priority 7.
ConfigItem.Desc: Enable audio source by assigning it to Priority 7.

If source selected above is anything else but 'Previously Saved' then it MUST be also enabled and prioritised in one of the i.e. 'Enable audio source by assigning it to Priority 1' fields.Setting is applicable to 'Manual' Audio Input Selection.

This configuration item specifies whether incoming audio comes from wired analogue, I2S or SPDIF. If USB is being used as an input audio source, this setting should be configured to 'Internal' (this is currently required because any back channel present must be relayed to the connected PC via USB, and this is currently only supported for the Analogue Input plugin - configured here as 'Internal'). Warning: when the Audio Input Routing has been changed to I2S or SPDIF, the USB back channel cannot be used.

ConfigItem.Id: Play from physical connections in limbo state
ConfigItem.Desc: Setting this flag will result in the Sink playing from configured USB, SPDIF and analog inputs when in limbo.

Sets the method of volume adjustment used across audio output groups. Hardware: volume scaling is applied at the DAC in the case of analogue output, or in external hardware controlled by I2c. DSP: volume scaling is applied in the digital domain by the DSP. Hybrid: A combination of DSP and hardware scaling is employed in order to maximise the S/N ratio of the audio output.
Sets a fixed gain applied to hardware in units of dB/60, only used when the volume scaling method is set to DSP
This configuration item specifies the output audio bit resolution. Note this is not applicable for CSR8670. On wired audio routing is is only applicable when output is one of I2S, SPDIF or Analog.
Allows the volume to be adjusted while the Sink has been muted (via the EventMuteToggle or EventMuteOn).
If the Sink is muted (via the EventMuteToggle or EventMuteOn) this flag determines the action to take when an EventVolumeUp, EventVolumeDown or an AG volume indication message occurs.
Enable this to force the re-sampling of tones and route playback via the DSP

ConfigGroup.Id: I2C Control for External I2S Amplifier

ConfigItem.Desc: Specifies how many I2C Initialisation commands are specified in the Raw Command Data
Specifies the number of individual I2C volume commands that will be sent to the I2S capable device every time a volume change is made.
Specifies the offset, in words, of the first I2C Volume command specified in the Raw Command Data
Specifies the number of bits of the volume setting in the I2C command.
Specifies the maximum volume value that will be sent to the I2S device to indicate maximum output level.
Specifies the minimum volume value that will be sent to the I2S device to indicate minimum output level.
Specifies the number of individual I2C commands that will be sent to the I2S capable device every time the device is shut down, i.e. on close of SCO or A2DP media stream.
Specifies the offset, in words, of the first I2C Shutdown command specified in the Raw Command Data

This setting determines which I2S plug-in should be used. The options availlable are to use; A) preconfigured settings for the Qualcomm SSM_2518 I2S Development Board; B) the provided Qualcomm plug-in which can be configured through this tool to target a wide selection of I2S interfaced devices; or C) a customer developed plug-in.
Specifies Master or Slave Operation.
Choose between left justified and right justified I2S data.
The I2S data can be delayed by 1 bit.

Specifies the number of bits in each audio sample. Bits per sample should be less than or equal to bit depth. If 24 bit operation is defined, Bits per sample should be configured to a minimum of 24 bits.

Forces re-sampling of all audio outputs to a fixed sample rate when an I2S output is configured, specified in Hz. A value of 0 disables re-sampling. Note, I2S outputs do not support re-sample rates less than 44100Hz, any attempt to force a rate lower than 44100Hz will result in no audio on the I2S output.

Specifies the voice (CVC) output sample rate when an I2S output is configured, in Hz. A value of 0 disables re-sampling. Note, I2S outputs do not support sample rates less than 44100Hz, any rate lower than this will be overridden by the application.
Specifies the I2S bit clock rate (BCLK) as a multiple of the sample rate, output when running in I2S Master mode.

Specifies the I2S master clock rate (MCLK) as a multiple of the sample rate. This is used to drive the bit and word clocks when running in I2S Master mode, so must always be higher than the bit clock scaling factor. In I2S Slave mode, the MCLK of an external device may be used to drive the audio interface logic synchronously. A value of 0 disables MCLK input/output.
This configuration item specifies the I2S Input audio bit resolution. Note: this configuration item is only relevant for I2S audio input. It is not applicable for CSR8670.

This threshold is used to configure the silence detection used in the DSP. It is a linear level expressed as a 16 bit integer, where 32767 is full scale and specifying a value of zero will disable the feature. If you wish to convert this into a value in dB units, the threshold to be set can be calculated as: 32767 * 10 ^ (dBthresh / 20) Where dBthresh is the threshold level (quoted as dBFS). 10 is a reasonable default for the threshold (it equates to -70 dBFS).
The time delay between silence being detected and the Audio Active PIO being driven, specified in seconds.

ConfigItem.Id: Enable Mixing of Voice and Audio
ConfigItem.Desc: Determines if Voice (HFP) audio is mixed with Analogue audio input.
Select audio sampling rate for wired audio Input interface. Note: High Res sample rates (88.2 and 96 Khz) are not avaibale on CSR8670

ConfigItem.Id: Output sampling rate when routing wired audio sources
ConfigItem.Desc: Set the playback sample rate to use when routing analogue, I2S or SPDIF inputs. Note that if a resampling rate is explicitly set for the I2S output it will override this value. When the wireless subwoofer functionality is enabled all output playback is at a fixed rate of 48kHz which will also override this setting.
When set, PCM block 2 will be used instead of PCM block 1 for I2S and SPDIF inputs.
Setting this flag will result in the Sink using the low power audio codec options to help reduce Sink power consumption.

This timer value, in minutes, causes the link encryption key to change when the timer expires, e.g. if set at 15 minutes the key used to encrypt the Bluetooth link is changed every 15 minutes, this improves the security of the Sink. Note: The encryption is only refreshed when no SCO link is open, i.e. there are no active calls. If the timer expirers when there is an active call, no action is taken and the timer is rescheduled for another timeout period.
When set the Sink will not send role switch requests to the AG. This feature may be useful if the AG does not support role switching.
When enabled the Sink is connectable while attempting to reconnect to a dropped device.
Enable to force automatic reconnection after Power On. The setting 'After Power On Connect To' controls what to reconnect to. Connection can also be triggered by a 'Establish SLC' event.
If the setting 'Automatically Reconnect at Power On' is enabled or an 'Establish SLC' event occurs then this setting specifies what to connect to. Also know as 'ActionOnPowerOn'.
ConfigItem.displayValue: Attempt to Reconnect to the last connected AG

ConfigItem.Id: Different SLC Connected Event at Power On
ConfigItem.Desc: When set, the event EventSLCConnectedAfterPowerOn is generated when an SLC occurs straight after power on. The event EventSLCConnected is generated on SLC events when the Sink has already been on for some time.

The time in seconds that the Sink remains in the connectable / discoverable state (pairing mode). Setting this to 0 results in the Sink entering and immediately exiting discoverable mode, with the result that the device cannot be discovered. If the Sink is to always be discoverable while not connected, then the feature Remain Discoverable at All Times should be used in conjunction with this timeout.

ConfigItem.Id: Pairing Mode Timeout if PDL is Empty [s]
ConfigItem.Desc: Zero to disable, if set to a non zero value this is the pairing mode timeout value, in seconds, if the PDL is completely empty. If the PDL is not empty the Pairing Timeout value is used instead.
Time in seconds to generate pairing mode reminder event, zero to disable.

ConfigItem.Id: Power Off after PDL is Reset
ConfigItem.Desc: If this item is set the Sink will power off when the paired devices list is reset.
This allows the action taken on a pairing mode timeout to be defined.

enum.key: Power off if PDL is empty

ConfigItem.Id: Enter Pairing Mode on Failure to Connect to AG
ConfigItem.Desc: If this item is set the sink goes into pairing mode if it fails to connect with any paired AG, otherwise it goes into connectable mode.
When set Bluetooth 2.1 Man in the Middle enabled. Enabling this feature requires further customer development of the Sink application to support Man in the Middle mode.

This flag enables secure pairing mode. If set, then the Sink only accepts pin code requests when in pairing mode (connectable-discoverable state). This prevents a remote user from pairing with the Sink without the Sink being specifically placed into pairing mode. This is over-ridden if the Sink initiates the connection. i.e. if the Sink attempts to connect to a remote AG without the correct link key (or has the bdaddr but not the link key).

ConfigItem.Id: RSSI Pairing if PDL Less Than
ConfigItem.Desc: When set to a non-zero value and the number of devices in the paired devices list is less than this value, the Sink goes into RSSI Inquiry (Proximity Pairing) mode.
The maximum number of entries that may be stored in the paired devices list.
This forces Encryption on SLC establishment. Some phone handsets no longer force encryption on the SLC. Setting this flag ensures that encryption is used.

Makes the Sink connectable on a button press. This is used with multipoint operation in the situation where one Sink is already connected and the user wishes to connect a second Sink and needs to make the Sink connectable to do so.
If this item is set the Sink remains discoverable at all times. This is useful for Multipoint operation.
This automatically enables discoverable mode whenever the device is connectable.

This forces the Sink to Enter Discoverable mode (pairing) if the paired device list is less than the entry. An entry of 2 would mean that if the Sink has previously paired with either 0 or 1 devices, then the Sink enters discoverable mode. 0 means feature disabled.

ConfigItem.Id: Do Not Go Discoverable during Link Loss
ConfigItem.Desc: When set the Sink does not enter discoverable mode if a link loss event has occurred.

Defines the AG that the device will try to connect to when a call that has been transferred to an AG is transferred back to the Sink (using the Sink). The Call Transfer Reconnect Action is evoked when the Sink is used to transfer a call to the AG then back to the Sink. This only applies to AGs that disconnect the Sink when it transfers a call.
ConfigItem.displayValue: Attempt to Reconnect to the last connected AG

ConfigItem.Desc: If this item is set the Sink silently reboots and reconnects to the AG in the event of a panic.
Sets the reconnection action type if the chip reboots as a result of an application or firmware panic.
ConfigItem.displayValue: Attempt to Reconnect to the last connected AG

ConfigItem.Id: Reconnect Last Number of Attempts to Try
ConfigItem.Desc: When using the reconnection type of LAST, this parameter controls the number of times the Sink attempts to connect to the last connected devices, a minimum value of 2 is suggested for this parameter. The range of ReconnectLastAttempts is 0 to 7.

This specifies the number of reconnection attempts following an establish SLC event, or automatic reconnection event, if set to 0 and the reconnection action is set to 'Attempt to connect to all 8 devices in the paired device list' the PDL will be traversed once only, if this value is set to 100 for example the PDL will be traversed for 100 connection attempts.
This is the timeout value, in seconds, for RSSI initiated pairing.
The inquiry transmit power used. See HCI_Write_Inquiry_Transmit_Power_Level command in the Bluetooth Specification v2.1 + EDR.
The peak RSSI value that any discovered devices RSSI value must exceed to be considered a suitable in-range device.
Defines the difference in RSSI values returned by two devices before the stronger device is considered suitable for the auto connection feature.

ConfigItem.LocationUlong: BlockId=419, MsWord=4, MsBit=0, MsSize=16, LsWord=5, LsBit=0, LsSize=16
ConfigItem.Desc: Defines the Class of device that the inquiry looks for. Class of Device Filter values are detailed in the Assigned Number document available on the Bluetooth SIG website.
Defines the peak RSSI value that any device's RSSI value must exceed to be connected to automatically, using the RSSI auto connection feature.
Defines the difference in RSSI values returned by two devices before the stronger device is considered suitable for the auto connection feature.
Specifies a limit for the number of devices found during an inquiry search, if 0 value there is no limit on the number of devices found.
Specifies the maximum inquiry time for device searching, in units of 1.28 seconds
Time to wait between inquiries, in seconds.
Specifies the number of results from a search that are stored.
When set this feature will prevent the connection to any device that is not currently in the Paired Device List.
When set, this feature prevents the Sink from trying to pair to a device that has been previously paired to the Sink and is currently in the Paired Device List.
When set, this feature forces the Sink to attempt to pair/connect to the entire list of devices it found during a search.

ConfigItem.Id: Start RSSI Pairing on PDL Reset
ConfigItem.Desc: When set, the Sink will start RSSI pairing automatically if the paired device list is erased.
When set Multipoint will be enabled in the HFP library. In order for multipoint to be operational it also needs to be turned on in the VM Sink Application, see 'Enable Multipoint in VM App'.

When set the possibiliy of Multipoint will be enabled in the VM Sink application. It is turned on in response to a Power On message and is turned off in response to a Restore Defaults message. In order for Multipoint to be operational it also needs to be turned on in the HFP Library, see 'Enable Multipoint in HFP Library'.
When set enables AVRCP control. This feature is not supported on some ROM variants.
If enabled AVRCP play status is used to speed up audio source switching.
An A2DP UI message will be delayed by this amount of time, just in case a disconnect occurs.
This feature is only present in the A2DP platform. It is used to specify the period, in seconds, over which to attempt reconnection following a link loss.
When set the Sink can stream audio using an A2DP link.
This bitmask specifies which codecs are available for use. N.b. A corresponding DSP codec application must be available if these bits are enabled or the Sink will panic.
Decreases the SBC bitpool size limit. This reduces the required Bluetooth bandwidth at the expense of reduced audio quality.

When set The Sink performs a media open when the A2DP signalling connection has been made and the A2DP stream had previously been suspended. This can happen if the Sink has suspended a stream and the phone has chosen to drop the signalling channel completely.
Sets the AV Minor Class of device
Default A2DP volume level
When set the Sink assumes that the AG is responsible for suspending the media connection when receiving an incoming call.
If this configuration item is programmed with a phone number, this will be sent to the Audio Gateway when a one-touch dial call event occurs on the device.
When set the mute command is sent to both AGs when using multipoint.
Mute reminder value
The time in seconds after which the network service indication is replayed if there is no network present in the connected AG.

The Sink applications include a Missed Call feature. This sends an EventMissedCall event when the Sink has seen an incoming call that did not get answered before being terminated at the remote end, this event is repeatedly sent if the MissedCallIndicateTime timer value is set to a non-zero value and repeats at the interval set by this parameter. Timer is in seconds.
This parameter specifies the number of times the missed call indication will be played at the Indicator interval time.
When using multipoint operation it is possible to use two different events for triggering a last number redial on Audio Gateways AG1 or AG2.
When using multipoint operation it is possible to use two different events for triggering a voice dial operation on Audio Gateways AG1 or AG2.
If this item is set it enables speech recognition in the sink.
It is possible to tune the time, in ms, at which the speech recognition audio prompt is repeated. This may be necessary depending upon the length of audio prompt instruction chosen.
Supported HFP Features.
ConfigItem.displayValue: HFP_NREC_FUNCTION | HFP_THREE_WAY_CALLING | HFP_CLI_PRESENTATION | HFP_VOICE_RECOGNITION | HFP_REMOTE_VOL_CONTROL | HFP_ENHANCED_CALL_STATUS | HFP_CODEC_NEGOTIATION | HFP_INDICATORS

ConfigItem.Desc: These flags specify which HF Indicators are available for use. Note: HFP_INDICATORS feature needs to be enabled to allow these individual indicators.
caller_name under QTIL supported_features.
raw_text under QTIL supported_features.
sms under QTIL supported_features.
batt_level under QTIL supported_features.
pwr_source under QTIL supported_features.
codecs under QTIL supported_features.
codec_bandwidths under QTIL supported_features.
Bandwidth to use for enhanced HFP audio.
Bandwidth to use for enhanced HFP audio.
Specifies the maximum latency.
HFP 1.5 voice settings.
This is retransmission_effort
Be aware that some of these flags indicate which synchronous packet types may be used while other values indicate the reverse, e.g. which synchronous packet types may NOT be used.
ConfigItem.displayValue: HV1 Enable | HV2 Enable | HV3 Enable | EV3 Enable | EV4 Enable | EV5 Enable | 3EV3 Enable | 3EV5 Enable

ConfigItem.Desc: This allows the Sink to send an answer (ATA) AT command if an incoming call is detected on connection.
When set the mute command is sent to both AGs when using multipoint.

ConfigItem.Id: Force Second SCO to use EV3 S1 Settings
ConfigItem.Desc: Determines the behaviour of the second SCO connection in multipoint mode. When set the second SCO connection is forced to use EV3 S1 packets for better interoperability with certain AGs. Note this has no effect if Secure connection is enabled and link is secure.
Enables HFP Audio Parameters configuration settings.
Supported HFP Features.
These flags specify which HFP codecs are supported. Regardless of this setting, the application will automatically select mandatory codecs of the selected HFP profile version.
When set noise reduction and echo cancelling is not advertised
When set the Sink will send extended error reports.
The time, in minutes, following a link loss occurrence that the Sink will attempt to reconnect to the dropped AG.
The time interval, in seconds, at which the headset will make reconnection attempts following a link loss.
The indicator showing service status.
The indicator showing signal strength.
The indicator showing roaming status.
The indicator showing battery charge.

ConfigItem.Id: Mute Speaker as well as Microphone
ConfigItem.Desc: If this item is set Mute mutes both the Speaker and the Microphone of the Sink. This only affects HFP, not other profiles, e.g. A2DP etc.
The time, in seconds, that the system waits before repeating the alert event
The time, in seconds, that the system waits before stopping the alert
The time, in seconds, that the system waits before repeating the alert event
The time, in seconds, that the system waits before stopping the alert
The heart rate minimum threshold value below which to alert the user
The heart rate maximum threshold value above which to alert the user
Specifies the name of the device manufacturer.
The charge current will not be decreased below this minimum level by the PMU Charger Monitor.
The charge current will not be increased above this maximum level by the PMU Charger Monitor.
This is the amount by which the charge current will be altered when it is between the minimum and maximum charge levels based on the monitored temperature.
Temperature where current will not be increased. This forms the lower temperature bound for the PMU monitor. Below this temperature the current will not be increased.
Temperature where current will be decreased. This forms the upper limit of the tolerated temperature bound after which the charge current will be decreased.

ConfigItem.Id: Temp monitor period if charger active [ms]
ConfigItem.Desc: Temperature monitoring period when the charger is active [ms].

ConfigItem.Id: Temp monitor period if charger idle [ms]
ConfigItem.Desc: Temperature monitoring period when the charger is idle [ms].

ConfigItem.Id: Temp monitor period if charger has no power [ms]
ConfigItem.Desc: Temperature monitoring period when the charger has no power [ms].

ConfigItem.Id: Action to perform when streaming music and the battery level is lower than Gas Gauge 0 whilst charging
ConfigItem.Desc: What action to take when streaming audio if battery level is low whilst charging is ongoing, an action can be selected to prevent audio quality from deteriorating due to operating with low battery voltage

enum.key: Limit maximum volume level until charger is disconnected and level is above Gas Gauge 0

ConfigItem.Id: Maximum volume level limit that can be used whilst charging when the battery is getting low, specified in as percentage
ConfigItem.Desc: Maximum volume level in steps that will be allowed whilst charging if the battery level is below Gas Gauge 0, e.g. 50 would represent step 8 out of 16 volume steps, this limit is maintained until charging is complete or charger cable is removed

PatternArrayConfigItem.displayValue: When Connected To Hub Trickle Charge

ConfigItem.Desc: The Vref input can be configured to use any of the available input sources given below.
This configures the time interval between Vref updates in seconds while charging, 0 to disable.

ConfigItem.Id: Vref Read Period When Not Charging [s]
ConfigItem.Desc: This configures the timer interval between Vref updates in seconds while not charging, 0 to disable.

ConfigPatternArray.Id: Vbat Battery Voltage Monitoring Threshold Settings

PatternArrayConfigItem.displayValue: Automatic Sending | On User Request for Battery Level | On Initial Reading for Battery Level
Automatic Sending | On User Request for Battery Level | On Initial Reading for Battery Level
Automatic Sending | On User Request for Battery Level
Automatic Sending | On User Request for Battery Level
Automatic Sending | On User Request for Battery Level
Automatic Sending | On User Request for Battery Level

ConfigItem.Id: Ignore Increasing Vbat Readings When Not Charging
ConfigItem.Desc: When not charging the device ignores new Vbat readings higher than the lowest previous reading.
The Vbat input can be configured to use any of the available input sources given below.
This configures the time interval between Vbat updates in seconds while charging, 0 to disable.

ConfigItem.Id: Vbat Read Period When Not Charging [s]
ConfigItem.Desc: This configures the timer interval between Vbat updates in seconds while not charging, 0 to disable.
When set, a PIO is used to provide drive to the thermistor circuit.
When the Drive Thermistor PIO is set, this parameter sets the required PIO to be driven when a thermistor reading is taken.
Delay in milliseconds between activating the thermistor drive output and taking the ADC reading. This allows the voltage level to settle before the data is sampled.
When set, the limit thresholds need to be entered as raw ADC counts. When clear they need to be in mV.
The Vthm input can be configured to use any of the available input sources given below.
This configures the time interval between Vthm updates in seconds while charging, 0 to disable.

ConfigItem.Id: Vthm Read Period When Not Charging [s]
ConfigItem.Desc: This configures the timer interval between Vthm updates in seconds while not charging, 0 to disable.

Up to seven limit thresholds may be configured to provide up to eight regions of temperature based charging control. The list is ordered in ascending voltage order. The values are in units of ADC counts or millivolts depending on the setting of vthm.raw_limits. If fewer than seven limits are specified, the terminating value is 65535 (-1).

Up to seven limit thresholds may be configured to provide up to eight regions of temperature based charging control. The list is ordered in ascending voltage order. The values are in units of ADC counts or millivolts depending on the setting of vthm.raw_limits. If fewer than seven limits are specified, the terminating value is 65535 (-1).

Up to seven limit thresholds may be configured to provide up to eight regions of temperature based charging control. The list is ordered in ascending voltage order. The values are in units of ADC counts or millivolts depending on the setting of vthm.raw_limits. If fewer than seven limits are specified, the terminating value is 65535 (-1).

Up to seven limit thresholds may be configured to provide up to eight regions of temperature based charging control. The list is ordered in ascending voltage order. The values are in units of ADC counts or millivolts depending on the setting of vthm.raw_limits. If fewer than seven limits are specified, the terminating value is 65535 (-1).

Up to seven limit thresholds may be configured to provide up to eight regions of temperature based charging control. The list is ordered in ascending voltage order. The values are in units of ADC counts or millivolts depending on the setting of vthm.raw_limits. If fewer than seven limits are specified, the terminating value is 65535 (-1).

Up to seven limit thresholds may be configured to provide up to eight regions of temperature based charging control. The list is ordered in ascending voltage order. The values are in units of ADC counts or millivolts depending on the setting of vthm.raw_limits. If fewer than seven limits are specified, the terminating value is 65535 (-1).

Up to seven limit thresholds may be configured to provide up to eight regions of temperature based charging control. The list is ordered in ascending voltage order. The values are in units of ADC counts or millivolts depending on the setting of vthm.raw_limits. If fewer than seven limits are specified, the terminating value is 65535 (-1).
Sets the USB VBUS voltage threshold. The charge current can be limited at VBUS voltages below this level.
This configures the time interval between Vchg updates in seconds while charging, 0 to disable.

ConfigItem.Id: Vchg Read Period When Not Charging [s]
ConfigItem.Desc: This configures the timer interval between Vchg updates in seconds while not charging, 0 to disable.
This information will be used in setting the Bluetooth Device ID profile fields. Indicates the institution that assigned the Vendor ID.
This information will be used in setting the Bluetooth Device ID profile fields. Should be set as assigned by the Vendor ID source.
This information will be used in setting the Bluetooth Device ID profile fields. Should be set as appropriate for the product.
This information will be used in setting the Bluetooth Device ID profile fields. Should be set as appropriate for the product version, where: 0xABCD = versionAB.C.D

ConfigItem.LocationUlong: BlockId=457, MsWord=5, MsBit=0, MsSize=16, LsWord=6, LsBit=0, LsSize=16
ConfigItem.Desc: This information will be used in setting the Bluetooth Device ID profile fields. Should be set as appropriate for the product version, where: 0xABCD = versionAB.C.D

ConfigItem.LocationUlong: BlockId=457, MsWord=7, MsBit=0, MsSize=16, LsWord=8, LsBit=0, LsSize=16
ConfigItem.Desc: This information will be used in setting the Bluetooth Device ID profile fields. Should be set as appropriate for the product version, where: 0xABCD = versionAB.C.D
This configures a PIO to enable the device to switch into DUT mode on power on.

This configures a PIO to detect whether the aux output is connected at power on. If configured this will mute the main output and un-mute the aux output on power on. If disabled all outputs will be un-muted at power on. This should be used in conjunction with main/aux mute events to mute the main output when aux output is connected.

PIO to force downmix on TWS session. When a valid PIO is configured here, downmix will not be selectable through Change TWS Audio Routing event, regardless of whether it is enabled or not on the list of permitted routing modes.
This configures a PIO to detect when SPDIF audio is being used e.g. when a connector is plugged in. This may also be configured to always assume this input is connected or disabled entirely.
This configures a PIO to detect when analog audio input is being used, e.g. when a connector is plugged in. This may also be configured to always assume this input is connected or disabled entirely.
This configures a PIO to be used for SPDIF input, it must be an odd number. However, this should be disabled for CSR8670 (SPDIF will still function).
This configures a PIO to detect whether the I2S audio being used. e.g. when a connector is plugged in. This may also be configured to always assume this input is connected or disabled entirely
Configures the PIO to drive when a call is active.
Configures the PIO to drive when an incoming call is ringing.
Configures the PIO to drive when an outgoing call is ringing.
Configures the PIO that is controlled by User PIO events.
Configures the PIO to drive when audio is active
Configures the PIO to drive when the device powers up.
Configures the PIO to drive for the audio mute line used to mask state transitions of the Power on PIO.
Configures the PIO to drive when the LEDs are used.
Configures a PIO to drive when a peer device is connected.
This sets a PIO to be configured for SPDIF ouput, it must be an even number. This should be set to 'N/A' for SPDIF output on CSR8670 (SPDIF output will still function).
It is possible to invert the logic of one or many PIO inputs using a 16 bit bitmask corresponding to PIOs 0 to 15, this allows use with different hardware/button configurations.
It is possible to invert the logic of one or many PIO inputs using a 16 bit bitmask corresponding to PIOs 16 to 31, this allows use with different hardware/button configurations.

ConfigGroup.Id: PIO Invert Mask Bitfields above PIO31

ConfigItem.Desc: It is possible to invert the logic of one or many PIO inputs using a 16 bit bitmask corresponding to PIOs 32 to 47, this allows use with different hardware/button configurations.
It is possible to invert the logic of one or many PIO inputs using a 16 bit bitmask corresponding to PIOs 48 to 71, this allows use with different hardware/button configurations.
It is possible to invert the logic of one or many PIO inputs using a 16 bit bitmask corresponding to PIOs 64 to 79, this allows use with different hardware/button configurations.
It is possible to invert the logic of one or many PIO inputs using a 16 bit bitmask corresponding to PIOs 80 to 95, this allows use with different hardware/button configurations.

Mapping assignments for PIO 0 to 15. To use certain PIOs that are shared with other hardware it is necessary to set the map pin bit for that PIO, if not set the PIO is not available for general input/output use. PIO 0 to PIO 12 are automatically mapped for general input/output access, it is not necessary to set the map pins for PIO 0 to PIO 12. Note for mapping PIO physical signals to logical input signals (for e.g. to cause User Events), see User Interface > Buttons > Translation.

Mapping assignments for PIO 16 to 31. To use certain PIOs that are shared with other hardware it is necessary to set the map pin bit for that PIO, if not set the PIO is not available for general input/output use. Note for mapping PIO physical signals to logical input signals (for e.g. to cause User Events), see User Interface > Buttons > Translation. Some platforms support mapping LED0-LED2 as general purpose PIOs PIO29-31. Any LED pin mapped as PIO will not be available for use as a LED.

Mapping assignments for PIO 32 to 47. To use certain PIOs that are shared with other hardware it is necessary to set the map pin bit for that PIO, if not set the PIO is not available for general input/output use. Note for mapping PIO physical signals to logical input signals (for e.g. to cause User Events), see User Interface > Buttons > Translation. Some platforms support mapping LED0-LED2 as general purpose PIOs PIO29-31. Any LED pin mapped as PIO will not be available for use as a LED.

Mapping assignments for PIO 48 to 63. To use certain PIOs that are shared with other hardware it is necessary to set the map pin bit for that PIO, if not set the PIO is not available for general input/output use. Note for mapping PIO physical signals to logical input signals (for e.g. to cause User Events), see User Interface > Buttons > Translation. Some platforms support mapping LED0-LED2 as general purpose PIOs PIO29-31. Any LED pin mapped as PIO will not be available for use as a LED.

Mapping assignments for PIO 64 to 79. To use certain PIOs that are shared with other hardware it is necessary to set the map pin bit for that PIO, if not set the PIO is not available for general input/output use. Note for mapping PIO physical signals to logical input signals (for e.g. to cause User Events), see User Interface > Buttons > Translation. Some platforms support mapping LED0-LED2 as general purpose PIOs PIO29-31. Any LED pin mapped as PIO will not be available for use as a LED.

Mapping assignments for PIO 80 to 95. To use certain PIOs that are shared with other hardware it is necessary to set the map pin bit for that PIO, if not set the PIO is not available for general input/output use. Note for mapping PIO physical signals to logical input signals (for e.g. to cause User Events), see User Interface > Buttons > Translation. Some platforms support mapping LED0-LED2 as general purpose PIOs PIO29-31. Any LED pin mapped as PIO will not be available for use as a LED.

This configuration item specifies that the device supports relay of audio to another ShareMe device. Warning: This configuration item must be checked if the corresponding configuration item 'Peer Device Support > ShareMe > Audio Sink' is checked.

This configuration item specifies that the device supports relay of audio to another ShareMe device. Warning: This configuration item must be checked if the corresponding configuration item 'Peer Device Support > ShareMe > Audio Source' is checked.
Determines how pairing information is retained for ShareMe devices.
A connected remote ShareMe device can issue AVRCP commands to an AG connected to the local ShareMe device.

Audio routing mode for peer with highest BT Address in a TWS session. Warning: Changing this audio routing mode will have no effect on a TWS device that has already been paired, as the routing is stored persistently in the paired device attributes. This routing choice is only stored on initial TWS pairing.

Audio routing mode for peer with lowest BT Address in a TWS session. Warning: Changing this audio routing mode will have no effect on a TWS device that has already been paired, as the routing is stored persistently in the paired device attributes. This routing choice is only stored on initial TWS pairing.
Routing modes which may be selected by the Change TWS Audio Routing event.

ConfigItem.Id: Fixed audio routing for this device
ConfigItem.Desc: Audio routing mode for this device. This needs to be configured on both TWS devices according to their final roles as it is not changeable in runtime.
Initial TWS Master device trim gain level, in 1/60th dB
Initial TWS Slave device trim gain level, in 1/60th dB
The increment/decrement applied to a device trim to change the current gain level, in 1/60th dB
dB value at minimum volume level, in 1/60th dB
dB value at maximum trim level, in 1/60th dB
Reserves one link normally available for Multipoint for exclusive use by a TWS peer device.
Device supports relay of audio to another TWS device.
Device supports receiving of audio relayed from another TWS device.
Determines how pairing information is retained for TWS devices.
Determines how devices connected in a TWS session behave when issuing AVRCP commands.

enum.key: Single Device with Power Off forwarding

ConfigItem.Desc: Enable or disable the required audio source for streaming to Peer in TWS mode. NOTE: Required audio sources MUST be also enabled in the 'Audio' tab.
Flag to indicate App to trigger opening of Peer media channel.
If enabled then TWS qualification for mandatory(standard) feature shall be enabled.

ConfigItem.Id: PTS qualification source audio streaming delay[ms]
ConfigItem.Desc: Delays the audio streaming from source to the sink. In order to use this delay, user must select TWS Qualification Enable Peer open flag. Recommended value is 1000 millisecond..
Determines if the LIAC or GIAC is used when pairing Peer devices.
Peer devices will use the Device Id record to filter suitable devices.

ConfigItem.Id: Use QTIL Peer Device Service UUID
ConfigItem.Desc: Use a fixed QTIL defined 128-bit SDP service UUID to identify Peer device support. Warning: In order to use a Custom UUID, 'Use QTIL Peer Device Service UUID' should be disabled and the 'Custom Peer Device Service UUID' in 'Configuration Set > Peer Device Support > Custom Peer Device Service UUID' should be updated to contain a non-zero value.

ConfigItem.Id: Always page lost device during link loss
ConfigItem.Desc: Always actively page for a peer or audio source if the link is lost. This may impair the quality of the currently playing audio stream.
Disconnect and re-connect the BT source when a peer device connects.
Allow peer to try establishing a connection.
The time in seconds after which the Sink switches off. If set to 0 then the Sink remains on indefinitely

ConfigItem.Id: Disable Power Off After Power On Time [s]
ConfigItem.Desc: The time in seconds after Power On for which the Power Off event has no effect. This is used for example, if the UI specifies that a long press on Power On enters pairing mode but a long press at any other time (including in the connectable state) should Power Off the Sink.
Specifies the amount of time in seconds the Sink remains connectable following a successful connection when using multipoint operational modes before not being connectable any more.

This value determines the delay time, in ms, between the connection of AG1 and the start of connection to AG2 when using multipoint mode of operation. This value may be changed from its default value if interoperability issues are seen with certain AGs.

ConfigItem.Id: Power PIO Delay on Power Down [s]
ConfigItem.Desc: Delay in seconds before signalling the change of state on the Power state output pin after system power down.
The value in seconds that the Sink waits in the limbo state for a power on event before powering off. The limbo state is entered when the device is powered or receives a power off event.

ConfigItem.Id: Store Current Sink Volume and Audio Source Timeout [s]
ConfigItem.Desc: The time in seconds elapsed after the last Volume Up/Down or Audio Source button was pressed, to store settings into PS Store.
The delay in milliseconds between the Power state output pin indicating system power up and the Audio Mute pin being released.
The delay in milliseconds between the Audio Mute pin being driven and the Power state output pin indicating power down.

ConfigItem.Id: GAIA User Defined EQ Settings Persistent Store Timeout [s]
ConfigItem.Desc: The time in seconds elapsed after the last GAIA command has been received to store EQ settings into PS Store.
The elapsed time, in seconds, before the device is powered off after a wired audio source is connected.

Analogue audio disconnection debounce period in milliseconds. Prevents the audio stream from being destroyed and then recreated in quick succession if the analogue audio detection changes within the specified time.
When no audio is routed the application will periodically check if a PS Defrag is required. Time in seconds, if set to zero the feature is disabled.

This configuration item is used in conjunction with 'PS Defrag Trigger - Minimum Available Keys' to force a PS Defrag to occur. The PS Defrag operation is checked at Power Off or optionally on a timer and will start automatically when the number of available PS Keys with a capacity greater than the specified 'PS Defrag Key Size' is less than 'PS Defrag Trigger - Minimum Available Keys'.

ConfigItem.Id: PS Defrag Trigger - Minimum Available Keys
ConfigItem.Desc: Forces a PS defrag when the number of available PS Keys with a capacity greater than the specified 'PS Defrag Trigger - Key Size' is less than the 'PS Defrag Trigger - Minimum Available Keys' value.

ConfigItem.Id: Disable Power Off after Power On
ConfigItem.Desc: If this item is set the Sink ignores the power off button press immediately after power on.

ConfigItem.Id: Power Off only if Vreg Enable Low
ConfigItem.Desc: When set this feature prevents the Sink from powering off if the VREG enable pin is not low.

ConfigItem.Id: Allow Automatic Power Off When Charging
ConfigItem.Desc: Allow automatic power off when charging and battery level is critical.

ConfigItem.Id: Reset Chip after Power Off is Complete
ConfigItem.Desc: When set the Sink will perform a chip reset after powering off. This may be used if the BlueCore IC is powered permanently with no other form of hardware reset available.

ConfigItem.Id: Auto Power On after Initialisation Enable
ConfigItem.Desc: This feature allows a faster Sink startup period by removing the need for a power on event to be configured on a button press.

When set, this feature prevents the Sink device from physically powering off after the device is made logically off, for example, after a user initiated power off event. The device will still physically power off if the battery level reaches a critical level or temperature is outside of operating limits.

ConfigItem.Id: Power Off after Wired Audio Connected
ConfigItem.Desc: When set the Sink is powered off after the wired audio is connected

Connectable | Connectable/Discoverable | Connected | Outgoing Call | Incoming Call | Ongoing Call with SCO | Test Mode | TWC Call Waiting | TWC Call On Hold | TWC Multi Party Call | TWC Incoming Call On Hold | Ongoing Call without SCO | Streaming A2DP
Three Way Accept Waiting Release Active
Three Way Accept Waiting Hold Active
Three Way Add Held To 3 Way

ConfigItem.Desc: If this item is set Tones are played at a nominal fixed volume regardless of the current Profile Volume level.
When set the Sink plays a tone when the volume is changed using the remote device i.e. the AG.
This allows volume tones to be queued in the Sink.
This allows event tones to be queued in the Sink.

This sets the volume level at which tones (and audio prompts) are played if the fixed level has been enabled. Fixed tone volume is enabled via the PlayTonesAtFixedVolume checkbox. FixedToneVolumeLevel can be set in the range 0 to 15.

This setting specifies the number of audio prompt sets used by the Audio Prompt feature (an audio prompt set could, for example, contain all the prompts configured for a particular language). Note: in order to use the Audio Prompt feature, this setting must be confgured to at least 1.
This item stores the number of audio prompts configured in the event to audio prompt mapping table.
When checked an audio prompt configured to indicate an incoming call will play to completion, even if the call is answered immediately or the call terminates.

ConfigItem.Id: Read out Incoming Caller Phone Number using Audio Prompts
ConfigItem.Desc: When checked, appropriately preconfigured audio prompts are played in sequence to 'speak' an incoming caller number.

ConfigItem.Id: Read out PIN Code using Audio Prompts
ConfigItem.Desc: When checked, appropriately preconfigured audio prompts are played in sequence to 'speak' PIN/Passkey/Confirmation messages.

ConfigItem.Id: Time Before Confirming Audio Prompt Set [s]
ConfigItem.Desc: When changing the audio prompt set currently selected, it is possible to have this change automatically confirmed and stored. This setting is a time specified as a number of seconds. If it is configured with a non-zero value, the audio prompt set change will be committed to non-volatile storage after this number of seconds has elapsed.
The time interval, in ms, in which a second press may be detected leading to a double press event instead of reporting the button press as a single press.
The time a button has to be pressed for, in ms, in order to generate a long timer message.
The time a button has to be pressed for, in ms, in order to generate a very long timer message.
The time, in ms, between repeat messages being generated if a button is held down.
The time a button has to be pressed for, in ms, in order to generate a very very long timer message.
The number of debounce checks performed.
The interval between each debounce check in ms.
Define PIO_x/LED_x (to specify the PIO or LED pin connected to TriCol_a LED pins)
Define PIO_x/LED_x (to specify the PIO or LED pin connected to TriCol_b LED pins)
Define PIO_x/LED_x (to specify the PIO or LED pin connected to TriCol_c LED pins)

ConfigItem.Id: Override Filter LED is Permanently On
ConfigItem.Desc: If this item is set when displaying an override filter LED indication there will be no breaks in a solid colour display. Normal mode/event indications are suppressed for the LED chosen for the override LED filter.
This allows LED indicator patterns to be queued in the Sink.

ConfigItem.Id: LED Disable State Reset after Boot
ConfigItem.Desc: When set, after a reboot the LED enable/disable state is reset and the LEDs are enabled independently of the led_disable parameter. When cleared the LED enable/disable state is stored over a reboot.

When set The charger LED indications stay at trickle charge once reached, i.e. the indications only change when the charger is disconnected and reconnected. When cleared The charger indications toggles between fast and trickle charge indications as appropriate to the current state of the battery charge level.
Applies a scaling factor to the times used for all LED on and off times. It can be used to lengthen LED on and off times beyond that of the 2.5 second limit.

ConfigItem.Id: Ignore Button Event if Enabling LEDs
ConfigItem.Desc: When set this prevents a button from raising an event, but only when LEDs are being re-activated. It merely re-enables the display of LEDs (when they had previously timed out) but the associated event with the button press will not occur.
GAIA session enabled on connection.
This specifies the SQIF partition to use for GAIA Over-the-Air Device Firmware Upgrade.
GAIA connection remains after power off.
If this is true then the application configuration will be reset to the default values built into the upgraded application when an upgrade is committed.

ConfigGroup.Id: Advanced Settings that were an Expert Node

ConfigItem.Desc: If LED is enabled.
The last requested audio source.
The number of free partitions available
1 = Inverts the operation of the volume controls, 0 = Volume control normal orientation.

ConfigItem.Id: I2C Raw Command Data Configuration Length
ConfigItem.Desc: Specifies the length of the I2C Raw Command Data block.
1 = Enable Low Battery intelligent Power Management, 0 = Disable Low Battery intelligent Power Management.
Analog Main Volume
Analog Aux Volume
S/PDIF Main Volume
S/PDIF Aux Volume
Max remote latency for slc link
Min remote latency for slc link
Min Local Timeout for slc link
Max remote latency for sco link
Min remote latency for sco link
Min Local Timeout for sco

ConfigPatternArray.Id: Event to AT Command Mapping Definition

ConfigItem.Desc: Input to use in test mode.
When set, the internal current source is used to provide drive to the thermistor circuit.
page scan interval
page scan window
inquiry scan interval
inquiry scan windowl
